title: Fix missing logo rendering across the site

requirements.text: Fix the site logo not appearing by ensuring the referenced logo asset exists in the frontend static assets and that all logo references point to the correct, existing filename/path (centralized in frontend/src/lib/brandAssets.ts).
acceptanceCriteria: The logo image loads successfully (no broken-image icon) in the SiteHeader, SiteFooter, HomePage hero, and LogoMotif components.
BRAND_ASSETS.logo in frontend/src/lib/brandAssets.ts points to a file that exists under the frontend’s publicly served static assets (e.g., /assets/generated/...).
Hard-refreshing the deployed site still shows the logo (not dependent on cache).

requirements.text: Add resilient UI fallbacks for the logo elements so that if the logo asset fails to load, users still see a visible brand mark (e.g., a small text fallback or simple inline SVG) without layout breakage.
acceptanceCriteria: If the logo image fails to load, the header/footer/hero do not show a broken-image icon and instead show a clean fallback while preserving spacing/alignment.
When the logo loads normally, no fallback is visible and the UI matches the intended design.

requirements.text: Ensure SEO and social meta image references in frontend/index.html use the same correct logo asset path as the rest of the app (via the canonical generated logo filename) so the site’s OG/Twitter images are not broken.
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/index.html og:image and twitter:image reference a valid, existing asset path that returns the image successfully.
Favicon reference remains valid and loads correctly in the browser tab.

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only).
Keep the backend unchanged unless strictly necessary; this issue should be solved via frontend static assets and references.
nonGoals: Adding new pages or changing the website’s information architecture.
Implementing new authentication or backend data features.

edits: Normalize uploaded logo into optimized square PNG (Screenshot 2026-02-07 154246.png > taste-tales-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Derive a high-contrast favicon from the uploaded logo (Screenshot 2026-02-07 154246.png > taste-tales-favicon.dim_64x64.png)
